author: Priya K.

description: bland and overpriced.  me personally, i prefer more flavor.  portions were kinda on the skimp side.  dont know how they justify those prices.  id rather pick up some bulgolgi at costco - 3lb for 15 bucks, has more flavor, thats wassup.  ur payin roughly the same at skimp toe bul yi for less than a pound for the same price.  betta hit up costco son.
author: Peter N.

description:
This is an old favorite of me and my parents.  This time, my dad and I ordered the steamed fish and the spicy tofu soup.  The spicy tofu soup was fabulous and warmed our tummies on a chilly day.  I love scooping out the tofu pieces onto my bowl of rice and eating it together.  However, I was a bit disappointed by the fish- it came in two 2 by 3 inches squared pieces and was extremely salty.  The only perk was that it came with 2 bowls of rice.  They served us 6 small dishes (it used to be more) which was average.  And this time, I was disappointed that they didn't give us 2 pieces of Korean gum along with the check!

All in all, it wasn't bad at all and definitely fed 2 people for less than 20 bucks.  

Note: You must try the spicy tofu soup!  It wasn't that spicy though, so you should probably ask them for "extra spiciness" if you're a chili pepper type of guy or gal.
author: Connie P.

description: this place is better than the average. This is the first time I have korean meal and I love it. Although the waitress is a little pissed when she doesnt understand what i am saying, but the food was great.. I am think i am going to try fried chicken next time..
author: Li L.

description: sooooooooooooooooo yummy~~and I never forgot the taste, I'd like to try again, anyway the price is a little bit expensive for me.
author: Olive S.

description: I love this place... I've been coming here for so long now.  I've never been disappointed with any of their dishes... uh... but that's because I tend to stick with my favorites... the soft tofu soup and their fried chicken, yum! The place gets really crowded right around dinner time so I tend to go earlier or much later to avoid the wait (it gets pretty cold in that area!). One thing to know... sometimes when they're extremely busy at dinner time they don't take orders to go.  Boooo.
author: Monica C.

description:
The fried chicken and the tofu soup hit the spot!! But it's probably also because after you've waited so long (sometimes outside in the cold) for a table, just about anything hot and salty tastes good.

And if you are a fan of drinking water with your salty meal, bring your own. It seems like it's always hard to get a glass of cold water in this place. 

But the people that work here are pretty nice. Just always in a rush.
author: m. e.

description: I often go to have lunch with my girlfriend here. The food price in lunch time is around $8~9. The food is really delicious!!! I always order "Bulgogi." really tasty!!  We also love "Kimchi." This Kimchi is No.1 in SF!!!
author: James N.

description: Solid place, great kim chee chigae (sp?) and fried chicken.  Service was good, pretty attentive.  I got the free dish - grilled mackarel which was nice.  I would come back.
author: Ricky P.

description: I love the food at this place. It very tastly and cheap. Their Tofu soup are so delicious. I would recommend all of you to try out this place.
author: Yoko S.

description: This restaurant has absolutely the best fried chicken you can find in the Sunset area, hands down. This is a must try if you live in the area and haven't already. Goes great with beer!
author: David L.

description: I only know this place as the chicken restaurant on the corner of Taraval, but boy is this place great. The first time we went , we ordered a bit too much food and almost did not get the fried chicken (we ordered it too late, and they had too many orders in already)   But the second time, we were saavy and had a plan. As soon as we sat down, we ordered: FRIED CHICKEN! please.  Almost immediately after we ordered we got the onion pancake (on the house). Then came the fried chicken. Delish. As we were busily devouring the chicken, the waitress brought the rice and kalbi and we realized that we needed to pace ourselves. Sitck to the plan! But, just as we were getting full, the waitress came to our table with some tofu soup. Naively, I thought she brought it to the wrong table, but then she said "on the house". What, no way!  It was the perfect dish to offset the fried chicken and kalbi (which was excellent by the way). It was just mushrooms and tofu, but the broth was excellent. We rolled out of there with a small to go box and plans for a return visit. $29 for what could easily be a $50 meal at any other place: 5 stars.
author: Mashi M.

description: This place is packed! Even on a weekday - this tells you how good this place is! I love their bibimbap!! and the sauce!!! Definitely gets me excited just talking about it!!!!
author: Judy L.

description: deliciously, satisfying korean fare!!! the complimentary pancake onions with a mild spicy dipping sauce was savory, as well as their soup with big chunks of tofu. the pork shank with their house special sauce was just average and we didn't expect it to be cold cuts. the notable deep fried chicken has to be ordered and we were so delighted how crispy, tender and mouthwatering it was, albeit it wasn't sodium/MSG laden. the small side dishes was also fantastic, especially the anchovies. we will definitely pay them a visit again & again until we tasted all the foods in their menu.
author: Nelle A.

description: Celebrating my birthday at Shin Toe Bul Yi has expanded my joy for trying other ethnic cuisines. The friendly lady who served my family brought six banchan--kimchee, tofu, fish (perhaps sardines), pickled cucumber or zucchini, pickled radish, bean sprout--and tofu soup, which is similar to a mild hot-and-sour soup. The #10 japchae, #66 haemul pageon (Korean style pancake and mixed seafood) and #67 yangnyeom tongdak (deep fried chicken served with house special sauce) arrived at our table in large portions, and the #4 dolsot bibimbap (mixed vegetables, beef & egg over rice served in sizzling stoneware) and #6 kimchee bibimbap (sautéed kimchee, beef & egg over rice served in sizzling stoneware) in decent sizes bowls. The seafood pancake was thick and I was only aware of it containing squid. I added some chili sauce to the pancake to kick up the flavor. The yangnyeom tongdak was an actual whole chicken that wasn't split along the natural joints, but it was still delicious! Though the chicken was moist and supple and neither salty nor greasy, I did find meat near the bone to be very slightly pinkish, as if the heat barely penetrated the chicken.
author: Cliff W.

description: mmm...the seabass soup was delicious!!!  i came here last night w/ seong p and another friend, and like seong said, we also got the seafood bibimbap and of course, the fried chicken.  the chicken was pretty heavily battered but flavorful.  they give you a TON of food here, and i really appreciated the complimentary fried mackeral and pancake.  service is speedy, and you can basically be in and out in 1 hour.  i guess they have to be fast considering the restaurant is tiny, and there's constantly a wait, even for a wed night!
author: Helen T.

description: went there for the first time the other night with a couple of other friends and left there on cloud 9.  they're known for their fried chicken.  oh boy are they good!!  the leftovers were even fantastic at 2am, after drinking all night.
author: Jaclyn L.

description: Delicious and authentic korean meal.  they give you lots of small side dishes and free tofu soup, which is really good. Came here last week w a group of 6, waited around 15 minutes (which isnt too bad), and got seated promptly.  we ordered the seafood bimbimbop and it was done to perfection. the sauce and rice in the stoneware pot was mad delicious, and i can bite into mini bits of seafood. the fried chicken, as yelpers have raved about, meets its expectation, and is soooo much better than fkcs.  the seabass is fresh and addictive.  a must go for sure.
author: Leslie L.

description: oh this place is so good. the food is always hot and fresh. smells great! it can get crowded for dinner though. so go early!
author: L M.

description: I totally prefer Mom's Tofu House in South San Francisco over this joint. The food is a little too salty for me, which took away from a pleasurable dining experience. Their banchan is also very limited compared to other Korean restaurants I've been to. I ordered their specialty, the Korean-style fried chicken and my boyfriend ordered the seafood kimchi bowl. At first sight, the fried chicken looked really good. It turned out to be dry. :( As for the seafood bowl, there was a bunch of different ingredients and it looked good but I didn't get the chance to taste it since there was so much food on the table. They give out complimentary tofu soup, which was a plus. The only good thing about this place is it's affordable and the portions are huge. The flavors are only okay. I had high hopes for this restaurant because of the reviews I've read and because it has been recommended by a few of my friends. Overall the food and service is okay, but I don't think I'll come back here anytime soon.
author: Anne Y.

description: so i didn't konw about this place until AFTER i moved out of the sunset.  it's so far away from oakland but the free mackeral and chive pancake subsidizes the cost of gas, toll, and driving time.
author: Amy L.

description: very nice of them to give us green onion pancakes and tofu soup on the house.  i thought the seafood bibimbap was pretty good however the kalbi was not so good.
author: Dorothy L.

description: great tiny hole in the wall restaurant. glad to have a decent korean joint in the sunset.
author: Craig I.

description: i wish someone had told me before i went that the thing to get here is the fried chicken wings - we wasted our time and money on below average soon doo boo and bi bim bap. go to han il kwan for that stuff.
author: Lisa M.

description: It's fried chicken for the gods, no exaggeration. Seriously, eat it - it's amazing. The other stuff, particularly the ban chan, are ok - nothing to write home about though. Taking away stars because parking sucks, service is brusque, and tables cramped.
author: Lemon S.

description: Another Korean place that I like in the city, but the line is long. I was waiting for almost an hours. Fried chicken is very popular here, you can see almost every single table order it.
author: S F.

description: After hearing about this place from friends, I finally tried this place this past weekend. Surprisingly, there was no line. Usually when we drove by, there would be a group of people waiting outside. But this time there were actually tables available and this was a Saturday around 7pm! We got lucky. We had no idea how big proportions would be. It was just my friend, boyfriend, and myself eating. We ordered the Kal Bi (short ribs to die for!), Seafood Pancake, and the fried chicken. The seafood pancake was a lot bigger than we expected. This was WAY more than enough food because we got tofu soup with our meal too! We didn't know that it came with it. So that was a nice little treat because it was very GOOOD! Overall, we really liked the food here and we will definitely go back for more! The only thing that bothered me was that the menus were really sticky. Probably because they leave them close by the tables near everyone's food and dirty fingers.
author: Steph C.

description: mMMmmMm. came for here a random dinner with a friend. got #46 calamari bok-um. omgoshness it was so good, but the spice went into my eyes and i started crying. lol!! their famous fried chicken (that everyone gets..) that kfc (korean fried chickens.) hella good too!! the food is amazingly good. the outside of this place look big, but the inside is small, very small. the wait can be ridiculously long, but it's worth waiting cus the food is good, right? and also don't forget to write your name on the notebook cus the waitress will call from the notebook. basically put your name and # of company. i will be back cus i love the food. mMMmmmMMm!!
author: Valerie N.

description: I can't believe this is the same Shin Toe Bul Yi I used to love.  I haven't been here for about 8-9 months and everything seems to have changed.  Maybe a change in chef?  Everything I ordered was SALTY!  Is salt on sale?  All the side dishes were loaded with sodium.  I swear it didn't taste like that before.  I ordered my favorite Kalbi and it wasn't grilled properly and it pieces were cut differently, but the taste was still good.  We also ordered the rice cake w/noodle, which was extremely salty and the tofu w/ beef stew, which was good.  They gave us two small pieces of broiled mackerel for free, which was ok, but I remember they'd used to give us the whole fish for free!  Also, the onion pancake that they used to give you as a free appetizer was gone!  Sigh....I think I'm going to have to start looking for another korean place....
author: Katniss B.

description: the tiny restaurant was the perfect spot for my hungry appetite,  the banchan came fast, including the beautifully grilled mackerel, which was on-the-house.  the kalbi was delicious although i spotted more than one piece of carcinogenic meat.  i'm not a fan of their soondooboo but i tried their sausage soup in a clear broth, which was decent.  almost all of the other tables ordered their fried chicken so it seems like the thing to eat here.  prepare for a wait when you first get here, but the customer turnover is pretty fast.
author: Big e.

description: This place has good food, but what suckers me in is that they give you more than the usual free dishes.  Not just all those mini appetizers, but also scallion pancakes and tofu stew.  One time when I went in a couple of years ago, I got a free fish(!).
author: Kenneth L.

description: Great Korean food. Down home, local, unpretentious, family run.  Go for the food, not the ambiance, and be prepared to wait.  The place is small and very popular.
author: Matt B.

description: This is a family favorite.  My kids love the green onion pancakes and the chicken teriyaki, I love the soups, bul go gi, jop chae.  It is finally a restaurant where I dont have to suffer through another meal of kid food and I dont have to suffer through having grumbly kids because but my kidsthink it is delicious too.  It is no frills as far as the decor but with food this good, frills are not needed.  We're lucky enough to live in the neighborhood so we can see if it has a long line and only go when we dont have to wait.  Judging by the line, I would guess that the wait time can be significant.
author: Kinsley B.

description: Had dinner here a couple of days ago, place was't bad.  Drove by it all the time but I never went in until my friend suggested it.  Usual little appertizers but according to my friend there is no more free pancake or chicken?   Don't know much about that but I enjoyed the food and it was resonabley price.
author: John S.

description: Not a fancy place, but very tasty.  Can be crowded on weekend nights, but not as bad as other Korean places (Brothers, I'm looking at you).   As noted, the kimchi chigae is super-awesome, and the fried chicken is damn good.  There's also a soft tofu spicy soup whose name I can't remember that is amazing.  Some things NOT to order: mussels, bbq pork.  Not that they're -bad-, it's just that they're the weakest thing on the menu.
author: josh w.

description: we were trying to do our final walk-through of our old crappy parkside apartment, and after waiting on the steps for 45 minutes, we decided to go eat instead. when i lived there, this place was always packed, so we decided to go. you write your name on a paper to get called, and the wait wasnt long. the wait to order was kinda long. but they gave us a yummy free scallion panckake. that was the best thing there. we also got free fish, it looked like bass? none of the 3 of us was too impressed with the food. i gave it 3 because of the free stuff. matts was lacking meat. jesses was ok. mine was ok. they were hungry afterwards i was in too bad of a mood (because of the apartment, not the restaurant) to be too hungry.  i had the hot beef with veggies rice and an egg.  it took a bit to get the check at the end. i havent had a lot of korean food, but this wasnt my best one out of those. go for a good average meal though.
author: Merredith L.

description: great local place for some good korean food. great service and freebies. only problem is getting a seat when it's dinner time. their fried chicken is really good. you have to go with a group of people if you want to try all the food on the menu.
author: Dexter C.
